poem:
Title: "Dodger in the Antipodes"

A cockney lad turned surgeon's hand,
In far-flung Australia's scorched sand.
From pocket-lining to shears gleam,
A twisted twist on Dickens' dream.
Knife-dancer in a chaos scene,
Where crimson meets the sickly green.
In roaring crowds he finds his Eden,
For sins of past are now forgiven.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Artful Dodger to Cristóbal Balenciaga: the seven best shows to stream this week Pick of the week The Artful Dodger Set in 1850s Australia, this roistering sequel to Oliver Twist reimagines Jack Dawkins (Thomas Brodie-Sangster), previously known as the Artful Dodger, as a former Royal Navy surgeon who now makes a living performing gruesome operations in front of roaring crowds. He’s left his days as a London pickpocket behind him – but the local". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
